ErrorIndex.title: Wrapper for index information inside an error.

causeCollection.description:
A lower-level set of structured errors.

Only oneOf `causeWrapped`, `causeSimple`, `causeCollection`, or `causeIndexedCollection` will ever be set.

causeIndexedCollection.description:
A lower-level set of structured errors.
Each of these errors MUST have index set.

Only oneOf `causeWrapped`, `causeSimple`, `causeCollection`, or `causeIndexedCollection` will ever be set.

causeIsInternal.description: If true, then the cause (`causeWrapped`, `causeSimple`, `causeCollection`, or `causeIndexedCollection`) should be hidden from the user.

causeSimple.description:
Simple string error type.

Only oneOf `causeWrapped`, `causeSimple`, `causeCollection`, or `causeIndexedCollection` will ever be set.

code.description:
the numeric HTTP error code for the response.

Deprecated: Prefer to check the request's HTTP response code directly.

details.description:
The optional details of the error response.
Deprecated: Replaced by `causeSimple`.

dictionary.description:
Dictionary/map of associated data/information relevant to the error.
The error "message" may contain {{name}} escapes that should be substituted
with information from this dictionary.

Deprecated: Use "values" instead.

domain.description:
The "domain" for the error.  If empty, it is an EDA
core error.  Alternatively it can be an EDA application
"apiVersion" value (e.g. interfaces.eda.nokia.com/v1alpha1)
indicating that the error is specific to that application.
The domain gives the receiver information that they can use
to help them interpret the "type" field.

errors.description:
Collection of errors in cases where more than one exists.
This needs to be flexible so we can support multiple formats.
Deprecated: Replaced by `causeCollection` or `causeIndexedCollection` instead.

internal.description:
Internal error code number.

Deprecated: "type" & "domain" should be used instead to uniquely identify this error.

message.description: The basic text error message for the error response.

ref.description: Reference to the error source. Should typically be the URI of the request.

type.description:
Type defines a unique identifier for the error, within the domain.
This may be used (along with the domain) to find an internationalization translation for the message.

SHOULD be a valid golang identifier, and SHOULD be in UpperCamelCase.

values.description:
Associated data/information.
The error "message" may contain {{name}} escapes that should be substituted with information from this dictionary.

Note that this map MUST NOT contain JSON objects (`{...}`) or arrays (`[...]`), only simple JSON types are permitted.

ErrorResponse.title: Generic error response for REST APIs.

Status.title: Status is a return value for calls that don't return other objects.

com.nokia.eda.pagers.v1alpha1.ClusterPag.description: ClusterPager is the Schema for the clusterpagers API

x-eda-nokia-com.ui-pattern-error: The apiVersion must be set to pagers.eda.nokia.com/v1alpha1
The kind must be set to ClusterPager

spec.description: ClusterPagerSpec defines the desired state of ClusterPager

routingKeySecret.description:
A reference to the Secret holding the Pager Duty routing key to use when raising events from this pager.
The routing key must be base64 encoded and set under data.key.
The secret reference follows the format `$namespace/$secretName`, if the namespace is omitted, the pager namespace is used.
routingKeySecret.title: Routing Key Secret

alarms.description: Include alarm sources in this pager

autoResolve.description: If true this app will automatically change the event status from triggered to resolved when the alarm is cleared.
autoResolve.title: Auto Resolve

exclude.description:
A list of alarms that this Pager will ignore, matching the 'type' field within alarms.
If a source matches both the 'includes' and 'excludes' lists, it will be excluded.
For example, 'InterfaceMemberDown'.
exclude.title: Exclude

include.description:
A list of alarms that this Pager will listen to, matching the 'type' field within alarms.
For example, 'InterfaceDown'.
include.title: Include

namespaces.description:
Namespaces to consider when selecting alarms for this Pager.
Alarms from these namespaces will be either included or excluded based on the other filters.
namespaces.title: Namespaces

alarms.title: Alarms

query.description: Include a query source in this pager

autoResolve.description: If true this app will automatically change the event status from triggered to resolved when the object is deleted.
autoResolve.title: Auto Resolve

class.description:
A template to use as class when sending the event to Pager Duty.
The template can use the fields from the subscription results.
class.title: Class

component.description:
A template to use as component when sending the event to Pager Duty.
The template can use the fields from the subscription results.
component.title: Component

fields.description:
Fields to include in the subscribe results, which can then be used in the template,
e.g. '.node.name' or '.node.srl.interface.name"'.
fields.title: Fields

group.description:
A template to use as group when sending the event to Pager Duty.
The template can use the fields from the subscription results.
group.title: Group

includeDetails.description: If true the query response is included in the generated event 'custom_details' field
includeDetails.title: Include Details

severity.description:
A template to use as severity when sending the event to Pager Duty.
The template can use the fields from the subscription results.
Must be one of critical , error , warning  or info.
severity.title: Severity

source.description:
A template to use as source when sending the event to Pager Duty.
The template can use the fields from the subscription results.
source.title: Source

summary.description:
A template to use as summary when sending the event to Pager Duty.
The template can use the fields from the subscription results.
e.g. 'Interface {{.node.srl.interface.name}} is down on node {{.node.name}}'.
summary.title: Summary

table.description: EDB table to subscribe to. e.g. '.namespace.node.srl.interface'
table.title: Table

where.description: A where clause to use for the subscribe request, e.g: 'oper-state = down'. You can omit enclosing parentheses.
where.title: Where

query.title: Query

spec.title: Specification

status.description: ClusterPagerStatus defines the observed state of ClusterPager
status.title: Status

delete.description:
Delete all instances of ClusterPager.  If ClusterPager is a namespaced resource, all instances in all namespaces will
be deleted, and this is restricted to users with the system-administrator role.
If a non-namespaced ClusterPager, it deletes all instances of that non-namespaced resource.
